Live from NPR News in Washington I'm Jim hawk President Trump is planning to tear up a thirty one year old nuclear weapons treaty that was signed by President Reagan NPR's Geoff Brumfiel has more on what it could mean
The intermediate range nuclear forces treaty was signed it the Nineteen eighties when the Cold War was going strong it eliminated nuclear weapons that the U.S and Soviet Union had deployed around Europe weapons that could have quickly started a catastrophic war
In recent years Russia has been working on missiles that the U.S says violate the treaty and on Saturday President Trump said he'd had enough
We're not going to let them violate a nuclear weapon not just for the arms
